section: Client acknowledges and agrees that all due dates set forth in the Scope of Work are guaranteed by the Company, regardless of whether the company receives required materials, documentation, or approvals in a timely fashion from the client. Delays will not affect the due dates.
explanation: This clause creates an inconsistency. It states that the due dates are guaranteed by the Company regardless of delays caused by the client. It is contradictory to guarantee a due date regardless of the actions/inactions of the client since the client has a big part in the ability for the company to get to the deadline.

section: Client shall make a prepayment of $1,900 and pay the remaining $3,100 on completion of the Scope of Work. However, the Client can pay the remaining amount at any time, or in multiple installments, before the Scope of Work completion.
explanation: The initial part of this clause mandates payment of the remaining $3,100 upon completion of the work. However, the sentence that follows contradicts this by allowing the client to pay this amount at any time, or in installments, before completion. This creates confusion about when the final payment is actually due.

section: Company is obligated to continue providing Customer Service throughout the duration of this agreement, and may not alter or cease providing Customer Service. Company at its sole discretion may at any time alter or cease providing the Customer Service which it has agreed to provide to Client relating to Client Website pursuant to this Agreement without any liability to Company.
explanation: This clause presents a direct contradiction. The first sentence states that the Company is obligated to provide Customer Service and cannot alter or cease providing it. The subsequent sentence immediately contradicts this by saying the Company may, at its sole discretion, alter or cease providing Customer Service without any liability. This creates uncertainty about the actual level of Customer Service to be provided.
